subject: CSS
question: Describe the Child Selectors, then in the next line write an example of a child selector, any "p" directly child of any "div"
answer:
The elements in the selector are separated by a greater than symbol. This means that the
specified CSS styles inside the curly braces will be applied to the last element of the right
that is directly a child of the element at the left and so on. Example of Child Selector: 
div > p { color: #ff0000;}
